senses.sense_definition: A large quantity of alcohol, usually sufficient to cause drunkenness.

examples.text: He had a <w>skinful</w> at the pub and struggled to walk home straight.
It is never a good idea to drive after you have had a <w>skinful</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The quantity of liquid required to fill an animal skin used as a container.

examples.text: The merchant sold a <w>skinful</w> of wine to the weary travelers.
He carried a <w>skinful</w> of water across the dry desert landscape.

senses.sense_definition: A large amount or quantity of something.

examples.text: The politician received a <w>skinful</w> of abuse from the angry protesters.
She managed to gather a <w>skinful</w> of information before the meeting ended.
